contentrichtext.text: {{coord|52.029|-0.997|display=title|region:GB_scale:5000}} '''Lamport''' (occasionally also '''Langport''') was a [[hamlet (UK place)|hamlet]] in the [[parish]] of [[Stowe, Buckinghamshire|Stowe]] in north [[Buckinghamshire]], [[England]]. It was cleared by the Temple family, as a result of [[enclosure]]s, after 1739, to improve the amenity value of their new park at Stowe.<ref name=fisk>{{cite web | last = Fisk | first = Stephen | authorlink = | coauthors = | title = Abandoned Communities - Stowe | work = | publisher = | date = June 2009 | url = http://www.abandonedcommunities.co.uk/stowe3.html | doi = | accessdate = 21 July 2009 }}</ref> The hamlet's name is [[Old English language|Old English]], meaning ''long town''.<ref name=uki>{{cite web | last = Quick | first = Kevin | authorlink = | coauthors = | title = Stowe (including Boycott, Dadford and Lamport) | work = UK & Ireland Genealogy | publisher = | date = 1 October 2005 | url = http://met.open.ac.uk/genuki/big/eng/BKM/Stowe/Index.html | doi = | accessdate = 21 July 2009 }}</ref> ==History== Lamport consisted of two ancient [[Manorialism|manor]]s, one of which was owned by the priory of [[Oseney]] and passed to Stowe; the other seems to have belonged to [[Luffield Abbey]], whose estate had passed, by 1350, to a family named after the hamlet, and subsequently passed by marriage, in 1416, to the Dayrells (whose name continues in the village name of [[Lillingstone Dayrell]].<ref name=uki /> It was annexed to Stowe to provide homes for the staff and [[servant (domestic)|servants]] of the new [[manor house]] there{{Citation needed|date=July 2009}}. In 1637, Peter Temple enclosed land around Lamport for his deer park. This aggrieved the Dayrells, who owned some of the enclosed land. A dispute, occasionally violent, ensued and eventually led to litigation in 1640 and a petition to Parliament. Notwithstanding the Dayrells' resistance, the village's continued to be enclosed and it was abandoned sometime after 1739.<ref name=fisk /> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Aylesbury Vale}} [[Category:Hamlets in Buckinghamshire]] [[Category:Former populated places in England]]
